Node.definition: = a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is the third in a range
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
= area enclosed by walls or buildings

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
= female, foreign ruler of a nation or area
= area enclosed by walls or buildings
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = process by which humans undergo certain processes or actions initiated by (other) humans or deities
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans stretch their arm in a certain direction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a staff carried by kings as a symbol of their authority
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a staff carried by kings as a symbol of their authority

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
= female, foreign ruler of a nation or area

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which humans communicate with other humans to request a favor for themselves or someone else
particle marking a phrase indicating a certain quantity; = marker emphasizing that the quantity expressed will not be exceeded
= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts

= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= a wooden construction used to execute criminals by hanging
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status
= state in which a countable entity is fifty in number

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans or deities consider a matter or an activity morally and/or ethically right
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= a wooden construction used to execute criminals by hanging
